author: d00dz
title: 3222 Review
review:
Initial info:

38cm (l) x 26.5cm (h) x 7cm (w)

605 grams - Total
163 grams - Box Only
Pieces? (Too tired to count them using the instructions)

So this set was the cheapest of the main vehicles of the airport set.
The Helicopter measures 33cm and from one end of the rotor to the other is also 33cm.
The Limo measures 21 cm long.
Took approx an hr with taking pictures in mind to build.

The helicopter is pretty nice as it has spinning rear and top rotors. Again no landing gear inserts.
The blue colour is nice and rich. Inside it looks slightly cramped but I guess it's the size is small so not much detail inside.
Nothing really negative about the heli itself pretty much as I expected. Oh the tail part is a sticker! LEGO make up your mind! Sticker or no sticker for the tails! Geez!

The limo is nice and long, it has 3 minifigs (driver, male and female passenger.
It has what looks to be a DVD screen inside, tinted (black) rear and side windows.
There are split doors for the passengers at the back which is a nice touch.
The bad things about the limo is that the wheels look WAYYY too big for the car, it's like it has been pimped out with wide wheels!
Would have liked to have clear windows for the passengers and the front driver. There is hardly any room inside the back for the two minifigs to do anything. But I guess it's a small car so yea.

I'd give it overall 3.9/5
Not my cuppa but interesing never the less.

For full review and pictures goto:
http://www.eurobricks.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=38136

author: knightsnap
title: Something Original for Lego City
review:
I really looked forward to getting this set this year. The instructions come in two parts, one for the limo and one for the helicopter. 
The build for the limo was fairly easy, and has a nice set of features, including computer for the passengers, ceiling lighting and lights under the carand a new hair piece for the lady (new for my collection at least). The car did flex alot when I went to place the passengers inside.
The build for the helicopter came in two bags, with the base being built first. The new nose and tail pieces are an inprovement over the ones from the Lego planes in the last two years. The rotor assembley is fairly strong, but does occassionally fall of under heavy rotation. 
Overall, the really thought that the set was great, and really appreciated the fact that it was completely different to anything they have released in either City of Town.

author: PluffTed
title: Ride and Fly in Luxury
review:
Pros:

This is definitely the hands-down best City set I've ever had, well, at least for now.  I picked this set up at my local Walmart in San Diego, CA and it's amazing!  The price was $29.99 which was a screaming deal for the awesome vehicles you receive with this set.  The building experience was short, easy, and fun. 

I'll start off with the limo.  The limo includes removable roofs, opening doors, tinted windows, and wine glasses!  I noticed some very peculiar features though.  The limo appears to have neon lights on the bottom of the car and also a head lamp above where the man and woman sit with their wine glasses!  Some people have complained that the wheels are too big for the limo, well I definitely disagree with this statement because Lego has used these wheels for almost every vehicle they've made and I'm really fine with it.

The helicopter was as good as the limo, if not better.  The helicopter includes a suitcase holder, chairs and a table where the man and woman can sit and drink coffee, removable roofs, and spining rotors.  I also think that the turning front wheels, engines, and opening storage compartments compliment the chopper very well.  I'm not a big "parts" guy, but thus set does have some pieces that you don't see often.  This set has very great playability where you can "pretend" that the man and woman are late to get somewhere.

Cons:

Even though this set is completely awesome, I have some complaints.  The first is that the limo should've included a suitcase holder just like the chopper did.  Maybe the limo should've included some sort of stereo or disco ball.  Another is that the wheel in the limo and the control panel in the chopper are both way too far out to reach for the driver and pilot.  And of always of course, the stickers.  Most of the stickers are hard to put on perfectly, but that's just my point of view!  Maybe some day, Lego will get it through their thick skulls that nobody likes stickers!  Oh well, you'll just have to get it to see!

Conclusion:

If you see this set at your Walmart or any other store, definitely pick it up because it's an exclusive, you get a great money's worth, and you can make your friends jealious!

author: Skut
title: One of the best helicopter sets ever
review:
Lego has done really well with this set. The reviewers above have done a good job with the pros and cons, but I think the aesthetics of the helicopter in particular need to be emphasised.  This is one really swooshable chopper, indeed probably Lego's best looking chopper ever.  Styling is a cross between a Sikorsky S76 and Bell 222.  A few of these sets would also lead to great MOC opportunities with the new parts - a Chinook or Sea Knight is an obvious MOC candidate.  The 6 wide new parts are also the perfect balance between the 4 wide "ancient" Town sets and the honking great 8 wide parts of recent years. 

Unfortunately I agree that the limo is spoiled by its wheels.  It's a great idea but the wheels really let it down.  Looks like a stretch limo trying to become a stretch hummer!

The only thing missing from the set is a paparazzo minifig!  5s all round.

author: legocity1
title: 100% Perfect :D
review:
First of all i have to say that this set is excellent even if you dont have a airport you can still buy this set
okay now onto the review

Pros:
--helicopter
--limo
--new female mini fig 
--2 clear wine glasses and 2 yellow cups
--lots of new lego pieces

Cons:
--propeller brakes off easily 
--limo cant go around corners very well
--stickers on the white engines peal off very easily 

i hope you find my review useful :D

author: minko54
title: 5 star travelling. (quite literally!)
review:
First of all the minifigs:

Pros:

  • The VIP man has my fave hair.
  • The VIP  lady has new hair?


Cons:

  • The limo driver and the pilot are too similar. (minor)


Rating 4 out 5

 

Next the limo:

Pros:

  • Nice design.
  • Lots of doors. (good if you build a lot of cars.)
  • 2x4 flat tiles i think they are new. (haven't seen 'em before.)
  • Nice tv.

Cons:

  • Can't turn very well.
  • Limos are big and so is this one is but the VIPs are to close to each other.


 

last of all the helicopter:

pros:

  • Nice design.
  • Nice helicopter front and back pieces.
  • Not to many stickers.
  • Two seats and a table.
  • Nice suitcase holder.
  • Nice side compartments.
  • Two coffee cups on the table.
  • Rotor blades are the perfect size for the model.
  • Not to hard to build.

Cons

  • The front is a bit higher than the back. (but two 2x2 flat on the back wheels does the job fine.)

author: diesel7777
title: A Great Set for the Summer!
review:
So I saw this set at my local Wal-Mart and at first site, I didn't really think much of it. But as I studied it more, I began to kind've like it and noticed that for $30, this wasn't such a bad set after all. So finally, here we go with the pros and cons.

Pros:
Two very-well made vehicles in one set.
A total of four minifigs
Very nice playability!
Quickly and easily built.
$30
Cons:
Stickers, who needs them?
Both Vehicles were a bit smaller than I anticipated.
Front wheel for the heli moves around too much if you pick it up, I know its used for better maneuverability for the heli but it doesn't look good to me.

All in all, I'd suggest getting this for anyone. Whether you're an avid fan or fanatic of lego, I believe anyone will have hours of fun playtime with this set.....and don't have to spend so much.

author: SgtSmash
title: A set for the high roller in town
review:
It's about time Lego finally came out with a set for the limosine ridin', jet flyin', kiss-stealin', wheelin'-dealin', son-of-a-gun in town! WOOOO!
 
I like this set for a number of reasons. To my knowledge, Lego has never offered a set like this before, with the chopper and limo, which offers a lot of play possibilities. Say you have some of the old NBA Basketball Lego characters. Shaquille O' Neal needs a ride to the Green Grocer, you can't very well pick him up in the town bus! Or, lets say you have a wealthy town villain? He can pull up in his limo to make people miserable. Or, an imporant businessman similar to Tony Stark? The limo driver can be Happy Hogan and they go on a bender and the police pull them over...the list goes on and on.
 
Anyway, you get the 4 minifigs, the air-taxi copter and the limo. I've only put together the helicopter so far, which was fun. The only complaint I had during the build was that the slanted blue roof bricks where the "Air Taxi" stickers are to be attached have what I can best describe as a fine "sand" like surface, not the typical smooth surface. This made the sticker application a bit tricky as they didn't want to stay in place. You could probably just eliminate the "Air Taxi" stickers altogether, which would make the chopper seem more exclusive to the businessman that comes with the set. But, I digress.
 
The female minifig is also an exact rehash from several sets that Lego has already introduced, such as the Grand Emporium set, and the Public Transport set. Same hair, head and shirt. The male "angry" face with the orange-shaded sunglasses seems to be getting recycled quite often as well. It's a shame Lego doesn't dig back into it's archives from time to time if they won't come up with new character faces.  
 
I saved the limo for my daughter to build. It's almost as much fun watching and helping her put these sets together as it is for me. For me, it's relaxing. For her, not only is it fun, but she is learning how to follow an instruction manual, use her hands and gets the reward of accomplishment upon completion. Legos are just plain good.
 
Anyway, the price is right at $29.99 USD, which is fair compared to say, the Pig Farm & Tractor set which was grossly overpriced at $34.99 USD. Not to always complain about the cost of sets, but with this recent court case maybe not going in Lego's favor, and the market no doubt about to be clogged with cheaper and inferior imitations...perhaps Lego will drop their costs on smaller sets such as these. Nothing will make them...but for those on a budget (who isn't these days?), it'd be nice!

author: VictoryForBrad
title: Elitist Minifigs
review: I've been looking forward to this set for a while, and it did not disappoint.  It's a little pricey, but you get a lego limo.  perhaps that excitement it all mine.  For folk who like interesting car models beyond one driver/two doors, this is a lot of fun.  the helicopter is also fun, but not as original.

author: clundsberg
title: A fun set...but a bit pretentious for lego land.
review:
I got this for my son and was impressed by the size of the helecopter (compared to my fire, news and police choppers, this thing dwarfs em) the stickers add a nice design, but probably unnecessary.  I wish th elimo had the windows up all around and maybe tinted plastic instead of black.  Ah yes, I can feel the jealously of the other legolanders and these overly-wealthy socialites go from limo to chopper.  Everyone in this set seems ecstatic except for the pilot who has a rather disgruntled look on his face.  I miss the days when all lego people were happy no matter what their role.

I digress.

For the price this has got to be one of the best bargains the newer lego sets have to offer. It is a very fun set to build and a great addition to the city and my son has been loving it.

5 out of 5.

author: Daniel_Valkenburg
title: Air taxi
review:
This set's helicopter reminds me a lot of the old air taxi service run by the KLM. Though one point of criticism could be; the lack of a door. But due to the complexity of fitting a hatch or door into the design, it is understandable that the set designer desided against it.

The limo looks great, the sideskirts are brilliant and the use of black bricks to create tinted windows give it a real "Vegas" look. Nice

author: TheLegoKid
title: Awesome Helicopter and Limo City Airport Set
review:
It was pretty easy to build but both are very crowded inside. Lego took a lot of consideration into building this set...

Pros
 

  • Pretty good value for money.
  • 4 minifigs
  • New female minifig

Cons
 

  • Way to tiny-nospace in the vehicles
  • No door for Helicopter.

I think I should have brought the passenger plane for another $10 bucks. I turned the Helicopter into a small plane because the Helicopter was to small!

author: legoparent
title: LifeStyles of the Lego and Famous
review:
Waited months for the set to be available in the US.

 

OVerall it is a great set, something different.

Price point is ok.

 

The build is simple, and the both of the models are sturdy.

 

My one pet peeve is the limo, does not have windows above the doors that open on the limo.

 

Highly recommend this set, for those of you to get a taste of the Lego and Famous lifestyle.

author: av8r1973
title: Nice chopper - ok limo, needed to raise the class of my city
review:
With most City sets aimed at the urban or suburban lifestyle, this was a refresher.  Until now, only buses, little sedans, taxis or even sports cars populated the streets.  Of course the emergency services group had a lot of room to drive around, but...

Enter the limo.  It's long!  4 studs wide and 2 1/2 chassis long, it looks almost a bit awkward.  Personally, a 6-stud wide SUV limo version would have made the scale look a little better and made more room inside, but this is a nice car.  Driver up front and room for two (just barely) in the back.  There is barely a millimeter of space for two in the back to enjoy the Cristal, but there's lots of space for luggage.

The chopper is nice!  Strangely, it looks a lot like the passenger jet with the same nose and lower-rear fuselage.  The engine housing is nicely detailed and is realistic.  The rotor structure seems to be fairly sturdy and has withstood the hectic flights my 5yo daughter puts it through.  As another member wrote, the "air taxi" stickers could have been left out.  They don't stick to the rough surface of the roof bricks.  Besides, if your minifig has enough money for the limo, they can afford their own helicopter, right?

As others have mentioned, there is nothing special with the minifigs.  You get four that are available pretty much everywhere.  They aren't bad, but LEGO didn't go out of their way to personalize this set.  A spruced up tux or an evening gown would have been nice.

Not a bad set, not essential.  Besides the engine structure of the helicopter, there isn't anything that stands out with some "wow" factor.  If you see it, and it's on sale, pick it up.  Otherwise, you won't miss it.

author: toofpikk
title: VIPs Only!
review:
Dear my fellow Lego fans, I present you this wonderful set. Very Ideal for something reasonable for a childs birthday, or for a little treat to yourself. I infact bought this set after seeing this fairly new nose piece (at the time) and saw the pimped limo with it, and drew it from the shelf to pay.

Main

Overall, this set is brilliant. Very fun for racing up or down stairs, and playing with younger siblings/kids. The wheels on both vehicles run well, which is a change for some of the recent Lego sets, and the designs are sleek and realistic. I found the airplane surprisingly spacious from past experiences, and very Ideal for the use it is made for. The set comes with 4 well designs mini figures, suited to the theme, and are also very versatile. The helicopter features the some what rare jet engines on the top sides, I've only had this in 2 sets before. The vehicles have easy access, and not a muddle of bricks to cause it to open enough to get your hand in, but rather only one or two, as the limos roof has been smartly designed so you can open it all up in one go. 

I did, however, find that the helicopters propellers easily broke, and so I had to rebuild them to make sure they didn't snap off during playing with it. Also, the limo, though looks large, Is cramped for space, and its hard to fit more than 2 people sitting down in it. (now I'm getting picky) the turning of the limo isn't good either, when I played with this set I wanted to let the limo go round the corner, but because of how thin and long it is, it takes a good 5 meters of space for it to do a full circle without dragging.

Overall, a brilliant set. Very good for stop animation, and a good compliment to the Lego city and modular sets thus far.

I hope you enjoyed this review, I haven't written anything in over a year, and thanks for reading :)

author: zipper
title: Two vehicles in one package
review: There's a lot that Lego offered in this Lego set. You have what is assumed to be a wealthy couple who own a helicopter and a limo, both of which have some pretty cool features to keep you busy. In all honesty though, the limo is a little on the plain/ugly side, but the helicopter more then makes up for it. This set is worth buying.

author: Orange_Lemons
title: An excellent, must-have set
review:
As far as my (small) city collection goes, this is one of my favorite of all.

Box/Instructions

I don't keep the boxes and the instructions are again clear.

Parts

While there are some large parts, specifically the ones that make the nose and back part of the helicopter, this is a decent parts set, nothing super special for parts, but still good basic parts needed for any MOC.

Minifigures

No outstanding 'must-have' minifigures here. The hair and torsos are nice though.

The build

Simple build. There shouldn't be any problems with younger children building and completing this set on their own.

The completed model

I must admit, the finished product is very sleek. It looks very nice on display.

Summary

This is a must-have set for city collectors as well as just a set anybody should have.

author: Drake_bd
title: One of the best sets LEGO ever made!
review:
I bought this set in a local toy store for â‚¬24.99.


The figs are nice, some nice tuxedos and the girl has a nice hairpiece.


The limo is my favourite vehicle, although I really like the helicopter as well.

The limo is very long, with seats for the wealthy passenger, who is seperated from it's driver, a feature I like a lot. The roof has a light in it (trans-yellow round 2x2 plate) and there is a TV.


What I like most about the helicopter is that the wheels roll really well, which boosts the playability a lot. The propellors also rotate really well.


Overall, this set is a must-buy and I totally recommend getting it!

author: BrickTVReviews
title: Travel around the world LEGO V.I.P style!
review:
Welcome Brickfans to BrickTVReviews@Brickset.com with set 3222 Helicopter And Limousine that is a limited edition set that costs US $30-35 with 4 minifigures and now lets go on to the review!

Box/Instructions

                                The box shows the heli and limo  with the VIP's disembarking the chopper with the limo driver and copter pilot in the background. The back of the box shows 4 more shots of the set and the HEY! There are 2 instruction booklets, 1 for the helicopter and 1 for the limousine.

Parts

                                 Nothing special except the pre-printed computer screen and control monitor panels, wine glass, cup and classic LEGO Town airplane jet engines and engine propellers.

Minifigures

                                 Included are 4 minifigures which comprises of 1 Helicopter Pilot, 1 Limo Driver, 1 Business Man and 1 Business Woman.

The build

                                 Not so tricky.  Not much to say.

The completed model

                                  Helicopter supports a blue colourscheme, its interior is made of of: 1 cockpit with 1 pilot seat and 1 cabin with 2 seat facing each other. The exterior has nothing to be informed except it is compatible with the pushback tug included in 3181 Passenger Plane. The back of the copter has room to put suitcases and luggage but no door! There is 2 cargo doors that can only hold 4 suitcases altogether. The limo has a drivers seat and a cabin interior with a TV and space to put 2 minifigures facing each other and has a cabin light.

Summary

                                  I give it a 9/10! I say you should get if you spot it! THE END.
